hero.title: Poisoned waters: Laguna de Bay’s steady crawl to brink of disaster
hero.description: (Part 1 of 2) Manila, Philippines — Encircled by the contrast of verdant and urban landscapes, Laguna de Bay is a silent witness to the environmental tug-of-war between progress and preservation

primary.title: LPA develops into tropical depression ‘Aghon’
primary.description: The low pressure area (LPA) east of Mindanao developed into a tropical depression at 2 a.m. on Friday, May 24, and was given the name “Aghon,” the Philippines’ first tropical cyclone for 2024.

secondary.title: 12 areas under Signal No. 1; Aghon now a tropical depression
secondary.description: Twelve areas have been placed under tropical cyclone wind signal number 1 Friday morning after a low pressure area east of Hinatuan, Surigao del Sur developed into tropical depression Aghon as of 2 a.m.

secondary.title: 'High-risk' emergency response protocols activated in 4 regions due to Aghon
secondary.description: The <abbr title="National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management">NDRRMC</abbr> and the OCD said the "high-risk" Emergency Preparedness and Response (EPR) protocol was activated over four regions due to Tropical Depression Aghon.

secondary.title: ‘Aghon’ raises storm signals, halts sea travel
secondary.description: Tropical depression Aghon was forecast to intensify into a tropical storm and make landfall over parts of Quezon province this morning, according to the Philippine Atmospheric Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration.

carousel.title: Accountability adrift: Murky gov’t data draw dreary picture of Laguna de Bay
carousel.description: (Part 2 of 2) Manila, Philippines — An investigation by Inquirer.net has shown that large amounts of human and animal waste have pushed Laguna de Bay to a Bay to a tipping point

carousel.title: 7 years on, residents in war-torn Marawi remain displaced, seek fair compensation
carousel.description: Marawi families affected by the five-month siege in 2017 appeal for adequate funds from Philippine government to rebuild their homes.

carousel.title: While ICC looms, House panel probes Duterte’s drug war killings for the first time
carousel.description: Lawmakers finally get around to asking questions about Rodrigo Duterte’s drug war, that have long been raised and exposed by the media, human rights advocates, and families of victims

carousel.title: House approves divorce bill in final reading
carousel.description: The House of Representatives approved on third and final reading a measure seeking to legalize absolute divorce.House Bill 9349, or the Absolute Divorce Act, garnered 126 “yes” votes, 109 “no” votes, and 20 abstentions.
